declarations.description:
High-performance data grid web component.
During migration, uses tbw-grid tag to avoid conflicts with existing datagrid.
Will be renamed back to data-grid when migration is complete.

## Configuration Architecture

The grid follows a **single source of truth** pattern where all configuration
converges into `#effectiveConfig`. Users can set configuration via multiple inputs:

**Input Sources (precedence low → high):**
1. `gridConfig` property - base configuration object
2. Light DOM elements:
   - `<tbw-grid-column>` → `effectiveConfig.columns`
   - `<tbw-grid-header title="...">` → `effectiveConfig.shell.header.title`
   - `<tbw-grid-header-content>` → `effectiveConfig.shell.header.content`
3. `columns` property → merged into `effectiveConfig.columns`
4. `fitMode` property → merged into `effectiveConfig.fitMode`
5. `editOn` property → merged into `effectiveConfig.editOn`
6. Column inference from first row (if no columns defined)

**Derived State:**
- `_columns` - processed columns from `effectiveConfig.columns` after plugin hooks
- `_rows` - processed rows after plugin hooks (grouping, filtering, etc.)

The `#mergeEffectiveConfig()` method is the single place where all inputs converge.
All rendering and logic should read from `effectiveConfig` or derived state.
declarations.name: DataGridElement

type.text: (row: any, rowEl: HTMLElement, rowIndex: number) => boolean | undefined

members.name: virtualization
members.default: { enabled: true, rowHeight: 28, // Initial state - will recalculate after first render bypassThreshold: 24, // Skip virtualization if <= this many rows (saves overhead) start: 0, end: 0, container: null, // Faux scrollbar element viewportEl: null, // Rows viewport for measuring visible height totalHeightEl: null, // Spacer for virtual height }

members.name: sourceRows
members.description:
Get the original unfiltered/unprocessed rows.
Use this when you need access to all source data regardless of active filters.

members.name: disconnectSignal
members.description:
Get the disconnect signal for event listener cleanup.
This signal is aborted when the grid disconnects from the DOM.
Plugins and internal code can use this for automatic listener cleanup.

members.name: getPlugin
members.description:
Get a plugin instance by its class.
Used by plugins for inter-plugin communication.

members.name: getPluginByName
members.description:
Get a plugin instance by its name.
Used for loose coupling between plugins (avoids static imports).

members.name: requestRender
members.description:
Request a full re-render of the grid.
Called by plugins when they need the grid to update.
Note: This does NOT reset plugin state - just re-processes rows/columns and renders.

members.name: requestAfterRender
members.description:
Request a lightweight style update without rebuilding DOM.
Called by plugins when they only need to update CSS classes/styles.
This runs all plugin afterRender hooks without rebuilding row/column DOM.

members.name: #initializePlugins
members.description:
Initialize plugin system with instances from config.
Plugins are class instances passed in gridConfig.plugins[].

members.name: #injectAllPluginStyles
members.description:
Inject all plugin styles into the shadow DOM.
Must be called after #render() since innerHTML wipes existing content.

members.name: #updatePluginConfigs
members.description:
Update plugins when grid config changes.
With class-based plugins, we need to detach old and attach new.

members.name: #destroyPlugins
members.description: Clean up plugin states when grid disconnects.

members.name: #collectPluginShellContributions
members.description:
Collect tool panels and header content from all plugins.
Called after plugins are attached but before render.

members.name: #updateAriaSelection
members.description: Update ARIA selection attributes on rendered rows/cells

members.name: #executeAfterRender
members.description: Execute all plugin afterRender hooks

members.name: #rebuildRowModel
members.description: Recompute row model via plugin hooks (grouping, tree, filtering, etc.).

members.name: #mergeEffectiveConfig
members.description:
Build the canonical effective configuration by merging all input sources.

This is the **single source of truth** for the grid's configuration.
All inputs (gridConfig, light DOM, individual props) converge here.

**Precedence (lowest → highest):**
1. `gridConfig` property - base config object
2. Light DOM `<tbw-grid-column>` elements - declarative columns
3. `columns` property - programmatic columns override
4. Inferred columns - auto-detected from row data
5. Individual props (`fitMode`, `editOn`) - convenience overrides

After this method runs:
- `#effectiveConfig` contains the merged result
- `_columns` is NOT set here (done by #getColumnConfiguration + #processColumns)
- Plugins receive config via their attach() method

members.name: #applyColumnStateInternal
members.description: Internal method to apply column state without triggering setup loop

members.name: dispatchCellClick
members.description:
Dispatch a cell click event to the plugin system.
Returns true if any plugin handled the event.

members.name: dispatchHeaderClick
members.description:
Dispatch a header click event to the plugin system.
Returns true if any plugin handled the event.

members.name: dispatchKeyDown
members.description:
Dispatch a keyboard event to the plugin system.
Returns true if any plugin handled the event.

members.name: #buildCellMouseEvent
members.description:
Build a CellMouseEvent from a native MouseEvent.
Extracts cell/row information from the event target.

members.name: #handleMouseDown
members.description: Handle mousedown events and dispatch to plugin system.

members.name: #handleMouseMove
members.description: Handle mousemove events (only when dragging).

members.name: #handleMouseUp
members.description: Handle mouseup events.

members.name: getConfig
members.description: Public method: returns a frozen snapshot of the merged effective configuration

members.name: setColumnVisible

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: The field name of the column

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Whether the column should be visible

members.description: Set the visibility of a column.

members.name: toggleColumnVisibility

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: The field name of the column

members.description: Toggle the visibility of a column.

members.name: isColumnVisible

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: The field name of the column

members.description: Check if a column is currently visible.

members.name: showAllColumns
members.description: Show all columns.

members.name: getAllColumns
members.description:
Get list of all column fields (including hidden).
Returns columns reflecting current display order (after reordering).
Hidden columns are interleaved at their original relative positions.

members.name: setColumnOrder

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Array of field names in the desired order

members.description:
Reorder columns according to the specified field order.
This directly updates _columns in place without going through processColumns.

members.name: getColumnOrder
members.description: Get the current column order as an array of field names.

members.name: getColumnState
members.description:
Get the current column state, including order, width, visibility, sort, and plugin state.
Returns a serializable object suitable for localStorage or database storage.

members.name: columnState
members.description: Get the current column state.

members.name: #applyColumnState
members.description: Apply column state internally.

members.name: requestStateChange
members.description:
Request a state change event to be emitted.
Called internally after resize, reorder, visibility, or sort changes.
Plugins should call this after changing their state.
The event is debounced to avoid excessive events during drag operations.

members.name: resetColumnState
members.description:
Reset column state to initial configuration.
Clears all user modifications (order, width, visibility, sort).

members.name: activeToolPanel
members.description: Get the currently active tool panel ID, or null if none is open.

members.name: openToolPanel
members.description:
Open a tool panel by ID.
Closes any currently open panel first.

members.name: closeToolPanel
members.description: Close the currently open tool panel.

members.name: toggleToolPanel
members.description: Toggle a tool panel open/closed.

members.name: getToolPanels
members.description: Get registered tool panel definitions.

members.name: registerToolPanel
members.description: Register a custom tool panel (without creating a plugin).

members.name: unregisterToolPanel
members.description: Unregister a custom tool panel.

members.name: getHeaderContents
members.description: Get registered header content definitions.

members.name: registerHeaderContent
members.description: Register custom header content (without creating a plugin).

members.name: unregisterHeaderContent
members.description: Unregister custom header content.

members.name: getToolbarButtons
members.description: Get all registered toolbar buttons.

members.name: registerToolbarButton
members.description: Register a custom toolbar button programmatically.

members.name: unregisterToolbarButton
members.description: Unregister a custom toolbar button.

members.name: setToolbarButtonDisabled
members.description: Enable/disable a toolbar button by ID.

members.name: refreshShellHeader
members.description:
Re-parse light DOM shell elements and refresh shell header.
Call this after dynamically modifying <tbw-grid-header> children.

members.name: #refreshShellHeader
members.description: Internal shell header refresh.

members.name: refreshVirtualWindow
members.description:
Core virtualization routine. Chooses between bypass (small datasets), grouped window rendering,
or standard row window rendering.

members.name: #setupShellListeners
members.description: Set up shell event listeners after render.

members.name: #handleToolbarButtonClick
members.description: Handle toolbar button click (for config buttons with action).

events.description: Fired when a cell value is committed
events.name: cell-commit

events.description: Fired when a bulk row edit session commits
events.name: row-commit

events.description: Fired to request mounting of an external view renderer
events.name: mount-external-view

events.description: Fired to request mounting of an external editor renderer
events.name: mount-external-editor

events.description: Fired when sort state changes for a column
events.name: sort-change

events.description: Fired after a column resize drag completes
events.name: column-resize

events.description: Fired when a cell activation intent occurs
events.name: activate-cell

events.description: Fired when a group row is toggled
events.name: group-toggle
